intro: Cheilogramme, commonly known as the Indian snowbell, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Himalayas and southern China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruits are dry, ribbed, and often have a distinctive, narrow shape. Cheilogramme species are typically found in alpine or subalpine environments, growing at high elevations.
